security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill for creating and packaging custom skills. Contains Python utilities for initialization, validation, and packaging. No malicious code or security concerns detected.

content.user_title: Skill Creator - Build Custom Claude Skills
content.value_statement: Create, validate, and package custom skills that extend Claude's capabilities with specialized workflows, domain knowledge, and tool integrations.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through the 6-step skill creation process
Initialize new skill directories with proper structure using init_skill.py
Validate skill structure and frontmatter format with quick_validate.py
Package skills into distributable .skill files using package_skill.py
Provide best practices for progressive disclosure and context efficiency
Template generation with proper YAML frontmatter and markdown structure
limitations: Requires understanding of YAML frontmatter and markdown structure
Scripts provided are in Python and require Python environment
Does not automatically test skill functionality
Users must provide domain-specific content and examples
Validation is structural only, not functional or semantic

use_cases.target_user: Developers integrating Claude with existing tools and systems

use_cases.title: Workflow Automation Skill
use_cases.description: Package multi-step procedures with scripts, templates, and guidelines for consistent execution

use_cases.title: Company Knowledge Skill

output_examples.input: Create a new skill for PDF form filling
output_examples.output: Guides through: (1) gathering concrete examples of PDF form tasks, (2) identifying reusable scripts for form manipulation, (3) running init_skill.py to generate structure, (4) implementing scripts and SKILL.md with progressive disclosure, (5) packaging with package_skill.py
Creates skills/my-pdf-skill/ directory with SKILL.md template, scripts/, references/, and assets/ directories with example files

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md body under 500 lines using progressive disclosure
Write clear, comprehensive descriptions in frontmatter for proper triggering
Use bundled resources (scripts/references/assets) to minimize context usage
Start with concrete examples to understand usage patterns before designing
Test scripts by actually running them before packaging
Challenge each piece of information: 'Does Claude really need this?'
Organize references by domain or variant to avoid loading irrelevant content
Delete unused example files generated by init_skill.py
Iterate based on real usage feedback
anti_patterns: Creating README.md, CHANGELOG.md, or other auxiliary documentation files
Including verbose explanations that Claude already knows
Putting 'when to use' information in SKILL.md body instead of frontmatter description
Deeply nesting reference files beyond one level from SKILL.md
Duplicating information between SKILL.md and references files
Using low freedom (strict scripts) when high freedom (text instructions) would suffice
Adding angle brackets (< or >) in skill descriptions
Exceeding 64 characters for skill names or 1024 for descriptions

faq.question: What's the difference between scripts/, references/, and assets/?
faq.answer: Scripts are executable code that may run without loading into context. References are documentation loaded into context as needed. Assets are files used in the output Claude produces (templates, images, fonts) but not loaded into context.

faq.question: When should I use scripts vs. text instructions?
faq.answer: Use scripts when the same code is rewritten repeatedly or deterministic reliability is needed. Use text instructions when multiple approaches are valid or context-dependent decisions are required.

faq.question: How do I make my skill trigger at the right time?
faq.answer: Write a comprehensive description in the YAML frontmatter that includes both what the skill does AND specific triggers/contexts. This is the primary mechanism for skill activation.

faq.question: What's progressive disclosure and why does it matter?
faq.answer: Progressive disclosure loads skill content in stages: metadata (always), SKILL.md body (when triggered), bundled resources (as needed). This minimizes context window usage and keeps Claude efficient.

faq.question: Can I create skills without the init_skill.py script?
faq.answer: While possible, using init_skill.py is strongly recommended as it generates proper structure, frontmatter templates, and example resource directories automatically.

permissions: File system read/write access for skill creation and packaging
